column4: When I play something through the mic input on my system, if goes straight through to the computer's speakers, but Audacity, etc. don't pick anything up. Ubuntu 10.10 32-bit, any assitance would be appreciated. :)
I assume this would be under lspci -- but which option under that output is it?
Care to elaborate on what exactly I'm looking for on that page?
try and change the setting using HDA Analyzer
/proc/asound/card0/codec* does not exist on my system apparently
cant see the soundcard from that output. Please run arecord -l
If I understand correctly, the sound card should just be: 03:03.0 Multimedia audio controller: Creative Labs SB X-Fi
As of Ubuntu 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex) and 9.04 (Jaunty Jackalope) they work fine is this "...work fine [by default]" or "...work fine [after doing these steps]?"
There not working at the moment right? So i would try those steps just in case you have nothing to lose
Well, all the sound works fine -- the only thing that doesn't work is recording from mic input.
I have had the same issue but i was using an Intel sound card and the fix was to play with settings in the HDA Anyaliser. As for creative sound cards i have no clue.... Sorry
Well, if you had this same issue and similar steps solved it, then it's certainly worth the time playing around with it. :) Thanks
Yea finally got it working, I wish you luck
